DataElement.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Prior Radiation Or Surgery Stable Disease 3 Month Prior to Registration Neurologically Asymptomatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria for enrollment on a clinical trial with regards to having received sufficient radiation or surgical treatment and having stable disease for 3 months prior to registration and being neurologically asymptomatic.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Prior Radiation Therapy Or Surgery Stable Disease Integer::3 Month Prior to Registration Neurological Signs and Symptoms Asymptomatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation._Definition not available._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Definition not available._Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._Earlier in time or order._The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled._A term that refers to the clinical manifestations resulting from pathologic processes that affect the central and peripheral nervous system._Having no signs or symptoms of disease._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Sufficient Prior Radiation Therapy Or Prior Surgery Stable Disease Integer::3 Month Prior Registration Neurological Signs and Symptoms Asymptomatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.:Definition not available.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Definition not available.:Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:A term that refers to the clinical manifestations resulting from pathologic processes that affect the central and peripheral nervous system.:Having no signs or symptoms of disease.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.
An indicator that a person previously received radiation treatment for the same condition.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An indication that a subject has had a surgical procedure in the past.
A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Earlier in time or order.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
A term that refers to the clinical manifestations resulting from pathologic processes that affect the central and peripheral nervous system.
Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has brain metastas
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has brain metastases, have they been adequately treated with radiotherapy or surgery, have been stable for at least three months prior to registration and patient is neurologically asymptomatic?
